title: Random Myth 1
myth_statement: Bears always attack humans on sight
fact_explanation: Bears generally avoid humans and attacks are rare when proper precautions are taken

title: Random Fact 1
myth_statement: Leopards can climb trees with their prey
fact_explanation: Leopards are excellent climbers and often store prey in trees to protect from other predators

title: Random Myth 2
myth_statement: All wild animals are aggressive toward humans
fact_explanation: Most wild animals avoid human contact and only become aggressive when threatened or protecting young

title: Random Fact 2
myth_statement: Wolves live in strict hierarchical packs
fact_explanation: Wolf packs are typically family units led by the breeding pair, not dominance hierarchies

title: Random Myth 3
myth_statement: Sharks need to keep swimming to breathe
fact_explanation: While some sharks need to swim to breathe, many species can pump water over their gills while stationary

title: Random Fact 3
fact_explanation: Only honeybees die after stinging mammals due to their barbed stinger; other bees can sting multiple times

title: Random Myth 4
myth_statement: Owls can turn their heads 360 degrees
fact_explanation: Owls can rotate their heads up to 270 degrees, not a full 360 degrees
